alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Randolph and southern Upshur Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mill Creek, or 13 miles southwest of Elkins, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Mill Creek, Dailey, Beverly, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Alexander, Eden, Glady, Helvetia, Pickens, Alton and Kanawha Head. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 31 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
